name: J
text:
So many choices when it comes to buying a new bike. I looked far and wide on the social media sites, visited at least four different bike shops in and around the Birmingham area. I found Chris at Guntersville Outfitters and was expecting something close to what I had experienced at the other retail stores.

I was in for a very pleasant surprise. Some background is in order. I was an avid cyclist many, many years back. I had gotten away from biking as my interests took me to other hobbies. I rode occasionally and then not at all. I still have bikes I bought new back in 2000 and 2002. Then about 5 rides ago I rediscovered why I loved mountain biking so much.

Nothing is quite as peaceful and at the same time as exciting as gliding through the woods on your bike and seeing the beauty of nature unroll before you. So reinvigorated and re-energized I began looking for my next bike. Kind of funny how technology had changed what I thought was top end back in the early 2000’s.

Enough about the history. I also have a passion for genuine, sincere customer service. I love the person who knows what to say and when to say it. Who asks about you and your needs. Who listens “between the lines” at what you are really saying or asking about. I found all these qualities in Chris at Guntersville Outfitters.

He responded to all inquiries quickly and thoroughly. He asked the right questions to understand my needs. He made recommendations based off his experience. I could not make it to his store until the weekend. Boy was I excited. Like a kid in a candy store.

When the weekend came I made the drive to see him. He greeted me by name as soon as I walked into his store. What followed was a very insightful demonstration of two bikes. We talked about the pros and cons to each. The benefits to me of one over the other. I never felt pressured. Never felt rushed.

I had a folder with at least a dozen used bikes that would have saved me money. While deciding which one to buy, I was able to watch and listen to Chris engage with other customers also. He was consistent and professional with each one. My mind was made up. I purchased my new bike from Chris.

I followed up with him to let him know about my first ride. He was quick to respond to my text with well wishes and an offer of any further assistance. I am very pleased with the service, the price and the overall value of the transaction. It is not always about the money you could save or the distance you might have to drive. It is about the relationship you build.

Thank you to Chris!

text: I just moved to alabama and things got left behind one of those things was a spoke tool. I went in with my mother because she knew where this place was. The guy was talking to me like i was stupid. On the flip side he dosnt know me. I fix bikes in my free time and he was trying to be helpful

name: Evan Waugh
text: Been there twice now. If you're looking for a store that is...more corporate this isn't the place for you.  If you want good service from guys that know their stuff, even if they aren't amazingly fast, this is the place for you.  I walked in with the specialized that I built when I was working at a shop in the mid-2000's. I knew it was showing it's age, particularly the drivetrain. The short version is $500 to get mine back in good shape, or trade it for a new one for an extra $500. It only made sense.

name: Randy Barefoot
text: Great service. The crew at Madison Cycles are friendly, helpful, and experienced. The prices are reasonable. They tuned my e-bike and I'm getting 10% more life out of my battery. Even adjusted the handlebars for comfort as an extra. Fixed my flat while I waited a few minutes past closing. Love these guys.

name: Jon G Woods
text: Slow service! No communication! Not serious about business! Went to pick up my bike today after it was dropped off exactly a week ago. I was told the bike would be ready the same day, hopefully by close of business. I did not receive a single follow up phone call all week. So I went in expecting to pay and walk out within five minutes because they were obviously waiting on me, right? When I asked the status of my bike, at first, he didn't know where my bike was located, I had to point it out to him. Then when I asked why my bike wasn't fixed yet he said, "we have a lot of bikes" and he shrugged. Then I asked him how long it would take to fix and he said about a half hour. So basically, he's telling me in 47 hours of a working week they couldn't get a 30 minute bike job done. Even if he had exactly 94 bikes this past week that each took a half hour to fix I still would be skeptical. Had to ask myself, "Why should I wait around another 30 minutes while he does a lazy poor repair?" But he did recommend to avoid riding the bike not to cause any further damage, "Ya think?"! No hustle no dedication. Go here if you want to be treated like your time and money are not worthy.  I decided to take my business elsewhere.i

name: Ross Lewallen
text:
Excellent service, very competent, and super easy to deal with.

A couple of months ago I drove the five-hour round trip adventure to Trek Bicycle Auburn with a friend who was purchasing a bike that they had on hand.  After talking with Ben, the manager, I was pretty impressed with the business and the level of knowledge and technical skills the staff demonstrated.  I was impressed enough that I returned last week with my Canyon for a much needed tune up and preventative maintenance.  JT and James took a lot of time with me to ensure that they fully understood what I wanted while simultaneously inputting their maintenance advice to absolutely ensure that my servicing plan was exactly what I needed.  I valued their advice because as part of my service I wanted new cables, chain, front disk brake (slight warp), and new wheel bearings.  They agreed with the cables and chain but went out of their way to straighten the disk brake and clean, inspect, and re-grease the bearings, which of course wound up being a much greater value for the money, at least on my side of the deal.  I have around 100 miles on the service and the replacement parts and the service adjustments and tuning are perfect. These small things combined with the quality of the final product earn Trek Bicycles of Auburn a great deal of trust from me, which in turn ensures that I will make that tedious drive every time I need service for my bike.  Additionally, for new bike purchases and bike accessory needs the store has many bikes on hand and nearly every accessory that one should want or need.  Thanks Team!

resp.text:
Thank you Ross
Ride safe

They had overlooked getting the bike in for me, but the very friendly guy who answered the phone said he would check with the warehouse on availability and call me back in about five minutes. It's been four weeks so it's apparent they aren't interested in my business. It's a shame, I am eager to buy a quality gravel bike and no one else in town has any in stock. Very disappointed.

name: Evan Chandler
text:
Kenny was a great salesman and extremely helpful to someone ready to buy their first quality bike. I told him my budget and he laid out the options within +/- ~$200 of it, while explaining exactly what benefits each bike had and how (if I wanted to) spending a bit more would save me in the effort of upgrading down the road.

I never felt pressured into going over my set limit and did not feel as though I was just dealing with someone trying to make a sale. He explained where each bike sat in performance levels and related specific components to the trails I would be riding on.

He recommended a Scott bike that was equipped with an air shock and remote lockout, both of which have been fantastic to have while out in the woods.

He also explained the current technology being used in helmets, assisting me in making the correct decision for the best protection, and even deciding on what color bottle cages/pedals would fit the bike. ("these flat black cages will complement the graphics on the bike. Yeah! Those yellow pedals will definitely work with the paint!")

Will definitely shop at Cahaba Cycles again and will call Kenny when I'm ready to upgrade to a full suspension!

name: daniel butler
text:
James Bros....Well Done.  On a five point scale, you all earn a six.

After all these years, I thought it important to write down how wonderful these folks are and what an awesome bike shop they have.  The Auburn area is most fortunate to have this asset in our community.

I purchased my first mountain bike 5 years ago from James Bros when they were still located in the bank building.  Although a novice at the beginning, I was helped to find a bike that would meet my needs.  I was not oversold.  I was fitted both in terms of how I would ride, my budget and my overall enjoyment with the sport of trail / mountain biking.

Well three bikes later, two for my daughter and one more for me, and I am still extremely satisfied with everything the team does for me and my daughter.  I have upgraded to soft tails and happy I have done so.  James Bros does an excellent job of keeping my bike(s) operating safely.  I cannot stress the term "safely" enough.  If you have loose or worn out parts, you are putting your life in jeopardy on the trials in the area.  The staff at James Bros makes sure everything that goes out the door is ready to ride - safely.

Eddie and Raleigh offer sound, professional advice.  They do NOT try to sell you something you do not need.  They DO make sure what you ride is safe and enjoyable.  They listen to you.  Really listen.  They find price points and products to fit your needs.  James Bros does not sell "cheap" products.  They offer solid value for the money for quality bikes and service.  If you need something they do not have in stock, they will find it.  They will service it.  They will back it up every time.

One example of how they help.   I needed a locking device for my new soft tail.  Eddie could have easily sold me what was in stock or even ordered a cable set.  However, that is not really what I needed.  So, he  suggested going a big box building store - Lowes - get a long length of plastic coated cable, a good lock and make the custom cable I needed for transporting and storing the bike in my truck.  Problem solved.  And he did it knowing he could have sold me a short cable set that would NOT have met my needs.

Each time I stop by, I am greeted as if I were an old friend.  That is how they treat everyone.  I would like to think I am special.  Perhaps.  But they treat everyone as an old special friend.   There has been more than one time when I have arrived near closing time when the team went ahead, took the bike in, and had it serviced before the end of the next day.  Eddie even came in when the shop was technically closed to help me with a part that was misbehaving.

Overall, I want to make sure folks know James Bros is a well respected bike shop.  If you need something, they will find it and help you with it.  Regardless of your skill or budget, James Bros will work with and for you.
Thank you for many years of a happy biking.

Sincerely,
Danny Butler

name: Erica Zacek
text: Helpful staff, good rental selection, good shop swag to browse. I was around for one weekend day in January and was thankful for the shop. Chewacla is a gem to have in their backyard.

name: Mike Lunsford
text: I highly recommend James Brothers Bikes in Auburn! Cameron and the owner Eddie were very knowledgeable and helpful. They weren't pushy like some places you go too. I will definitely buy from them again.

name: John W
text: Favorite bike shop! Highly recommend! Buy from here...very professional.

name: Stephen Hayes
text:
Awesome shop.  I was visiting one weekend and my bike was in the shop but I wanted to ride Chewacla.  The staff was great - they set me up on a nice rental, told me all I needed to know about the trails and also had a good talk about some new bikes when I got back.  Great guys.  My rental was only for 6 hours but they treated it like I was buying the bike making sure it was setup perfectly for me in every aspect. That is quality service...

Also, the shop was very well stocked - especially considering it is in a smaller town. I'm impressed.

name: Philip Faris
text: A+, 5 star, absolutely fantastic bike shop! I was in Auburn for a bike race and needed a quick repair to keep my bike going through the weekend. I arrived at the shop about 30 minutes before they closed to get it fixed and the entire staff was open and willing to help me out. They made sure my bike was taken care of and fixed properly. A big shout out to Raleigh, one of the members on staff, for being extra helpful and making sure everything was taken care of. I highly recommend this bike shop!

name: Russell Suther
text: Could not have found a better bike shop anywhere, staff was very helpful and not pushy in helping me find an outstanding bike for my grandson.

name: Joe Allen Dickerson
text: The entire team at James Bros Bikes are incredibly helpful! I've gotten my bikes maintenanced here, and they will give you a quote and even places that are need work. They even offer texting as an option for contact! Their technicians operate quickly and can offer incredible advice on what to ride and how to maintain your bike as you ride. There's plenty of room to park and it's easy to find from the road.

name: Bruno Ulrich
text: Been working with James Brothers Bike for over four years re maintenance on my two bikes.  I've never been disappointed in the quality of service, nor regarding their advise with respect to accessories. Danny and Amanda's integrity is above reproach.  I always feel welcomed, as has anyone I've ever seen enter the store.  I highly recommend customers visit their two stores; and, yes, staff at both the Auburn and Opelika make you feel just as welcomed as Amanda and Danny, and offer their advise with expertise be it road, travel, or mountain bikes.

name: Randall Plaisance
text: I usually have an idea of what I want - but Danny helps me figure it out exactly.  Then his crew makes everything fast and easy.  Quick set ups and quick high quality service.

name: Christopher McGrath
text: They repaired my 21 speed townie in the time frame they promised. They had convenient Saturday hours  and they are open until 6 most weekdays. The price was reasonable, the people were polite, the work was fast.

name: Tiger Limo
text: Great customer service. Will pair you up work what you want.

name: William Pavelec
text: A great place for knowledgeable people, who really go above and beyond, to take care of your needs. A real pleasure to do business with!

name: William Brawner
text: Great place to buy a bike.  Danny and the staff are helpful and knowledgeable.  Very patient with all my questions.  They offered a large selection of bikes and never came across as pushy with their recommendations.  Once I decided on a bike they got it ordered and ready to go quickly and when I picked it up all the accessories I had requested were already installed on the bike.  And I got the bike for a very fair price as well.  Highly recommend these guys.

name: Chris Cochrane
text:
WOW... I was looking for a great relationship out of a bike shop and, I finally found one!  It's hard to find that 'feel' that your business is appreciated. We're new to cycling and, it's a perfect way to exercise as I recover through paralysis and such. We live in Florida, but as Auburn grads, my wife and myself spend a lot of time in Auburn visiting my mother.  We decided to check it out and, we're very glad that we did! You won't be disappointed!

These guys HAVE to be commended on the personal service helping a handicapped man and his family. For instance, as I already mentioned being cycling newbies, we needed to find a car carrying method easy for us with my limitations and, find a specific trailer hitch/bike carrier that my wife can easily use without help.  A couple of phone calls later... the 'Hollywood Sport Rider' fit our needs perfectly and, showed up in two days! When we came-in to pick it up, they had ALREADY ASSEMBLED it for us!!  The thing is like a jigsaw puzzle! They didn't charge us to assemble it AND, the company is big on giving to the Active Duty a Military discount... I wish more American shops/stores/services etc., embrace the James Bros Bikes business model.  Thank you so much guys!  Can't wait until the next time! Cheers!

name: Shawn Wheeler
text: Very knowledgable and friendly, great products and good prices. Just bought my first 29'er from them and couldn't be happier, look forward to doing business with them again.

name: Keith Thompson
text: James Bros. is the best!  Awesome service and great people. I will always do my biking business with James Bros.

name: Noah Triplett
text: Nice shop, everybody was friendly and helpful.  All employees were very nice. Will make more purchases soon.

name: David Mackinnon
text: We stopped by this shop during our trip out of town from South Florida.  We were mountain biking in Chewacla Park for Memorial weekend.  We dealt with Danny James and the service and attention to detail was awesome.  We had a beginner without a bike with us and had to rent one,  normally the rentals would be for 24 hours but since they wouldn't be open the following day we would have needed to get the bike back to the shop before closing (4pm) Danny went out of his way to get our contact information and personally pick up the bike from us the following day so that our beginner could really get a good chance to enjoy the trails.  He also took the time to point out great trails and sites we should see before we depart.  When we got the bike he took the extra time to fit the bike to our rider and make sure the shocks and tires all had the correct pressures.  I've rented bikes from other shops and have yet seen anyone else take this extra time and effort.  Any time I'm in the area you can bet on me returning to this shop for my needs.

name: Ronald Shaw
text: This is my bike shop of choice. The staff is super and the products are quality. I may look at bikes in other stores but when I am ready to make a purchase, you will find me at James Brothers!

name: Darren Berry
text: Good service and nice courteous staff.

name: Caroline Donnelly
text: Took our Surly Trolls in to have new chains installed and a general safety check. Taylor did a fantastic job . We love James Brothers bikes and wouldn't go anywhere else . Super service and always with a smile.

name: Randall Marshall
text: Excellent service and selection. Wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Carter Brown
text: Great service and selection. Best bike shop around.

name: thomas colbert
text: Very helpful in finding parts I needed! Best bike shop in Auburn!

name: Sam Bartlett
text: Great store, very helpful and friendly employees.

name: Allen Adams
text: Great local bike shop!

name: Kendall Simmons
text: 2nd to none!

name: Kristin Deaton
text: Y’all rocked it! I called the day before to make sure they had the bike I wanted. They answered my questions. When I came in they made sure the bike was in perfect working order for my son!

name: Jean Beaumont
text: Nice experience .., we came from Quebec and Bicycle Cove provided us with new Trek Bikes that we rented after booking them from Canada ..., Really Satisfied ...

name: Brian Miller
text: Our family has always had a positive experience.  Staff is very knowledgeable and always friendly.  They consistently go out of their way to make it right.  And, they have put on great little seminars for the local youth on bike maintenance for both the NICA team youth, as well as the Boy Scouts that I have seen first hand.  Great to have them in our neighborhood!

name: Cheryl Barnes
text: Excellent bike shop. The staff is very knowledgeable and always willing to go the”extra mile” to help me. I have bought several bikes here and recommend them👍👍

name: Rebecca Dotson
text: Great service.  We have bought all our bikes here and had them all serviced continuously here.  Friendly and very knowledgeable staff.

name: Clint (Radiozombie)
text: Was greeted at the door by happy helpful and friendly staff. Dropped off bikes for service and picked up some parts for a DIY project at the house.

name: Mic Roa
text:
Placed an order for a bike. There was an error on the invoice (size should have been medium instead of large) that I pointed out to the employee who took my order. I was assured it would get fixed. Time passes and I get a call from the store telling me that the bike is ready for pickup. Arrived at the store to quickly realize the error never got fixed. The bike size was incorrect.

The store did however try and reorder the correct size bike several times but was damaged (no fault of Bicycle Cove) intransit.

Will look elsewhere because of the invoice error debacle.

name: Mike Hoger
text: Quick,friendly, expert service department with reasonable prices!

name: Steve Holland
text: Good customer service but today....... They went even further and hosted 2 sessions of bike maintenance for middle and high school kids on the local NICA race teams.  Basic to more advanced skills for the high schoolers.

name: Ed Santiago
text: It is my shop to go for bike maintenance and fixing.  Also, Chris is amazing doing g bike Fiting

name: J Mc
text: We have bought many things from Bicycle Cove, both before and since the pandemic. We'll always shop here, although it's a little troubling that they really only sell one brand of mountain bike (Trek). Ruth, Tom and the crew are awesome.

name: Julie Satterfeal
text: This was the easiest purchase I have ever made, and walked away with the perfect bicycle for me!

name: Travis Willis
text: What I like and appreciate was that it didn't take long for my bike to arrive, for it was already on pre-order.  The staff was professional and knowledgeable. I haven't bought a bike in years and enjoyed the experience and still. The facility was nice and clean and safe. I look forward to getting my next bike from them as well.  Thanks

name: Richard Wegrich
text: Found exactly the bike I was looking for, and they had it built the same day. Great staff, very friendly and knowledgeable about the different bikes and options.

name: Hunter Pearson
text: Great service!  I can always count on these guys to get my bikes back up running in tip top shape.  Highly recommend!

name: Richard LeVan
text: Really enjoyed my first experience with bike cove.  Ended up ordering a bike and some accessories while I was at it.  Also bought some parts to keep my old bike going until the new one gets in.

name: Christy Price
text: Nice people every time I've been there. Wasn't expecting my bike to be tuned while I waited. I was glad I didn't have to drive 45mins home and then back to pick it up.

name: Bianca Walker
text: Great customer service, everyone is always very polite and courteous. Bike Service is always been done in a timely manner!! We’ll be back for sure!!!

name: Jim McEuen
text: Customer service and expertise setting up my new bicycle was great.

name: Mary Knight
text: Really liked the personal attention.  Kudos to Bicycle Cove for letting me pick up my bike after closing.  I’m really glad I chose Bicycle Cove to do my bicycle business with.  Thanks to Ruth for putting my repair bag together for those just in case moments.

name: Julie Heflin
text: Great folks and thorough service!

name: karl stine
text: Very excellent customer service.

name: Harry Greenbaum
text: They have been absolutely buried during quarantine, but still providing excellent service.  A couple weeks ago the Hampton Cove location gave me a great deal on a previously owned, but like new, Trek that has been the perfect first bike for my son.  The Madison location sold me a great Trek hybrid today that is my first new bike since college.  Very thankful they are open providing us with a great activity during Covid-19 life that I know we will continue to enjoy for years to come!

name: Bobby Allen
text: Always helpful and knowledgeable! The best Trek dealer around.

name: Robert Handford
text: A few days ago I gave Bicycle Cove a bad review based on my experience with service scheduling and the price of a pair of gloves. After I posted my review, I expressed my concern in person and Chris immediately apologized and discounted the price on the gloves. I'm totally satisfied now.  Thanks very much!!!

resp.text:
Robert,

This is hugely disappointing.  I thought I had made things right on Friday when you came into the store.  I explained that product pricing and labeling happens at Trek.  However, there are times when Trek changes prices or puts things on sale without our knowledge.  Because of this we always happily match prices on trekbikes.com. In your case, I applied the difference in what you paid to your service estimate, You assured me this was acceptable, and mistakes happen sometimes..  I do, however, understand unmet expectations concerning the estimate for your bike service is frustrating. I'm sorry it took longer than we communicated.

Thanks,
Chris

name: Steve Drake
text: Tom and crew take great care of our bikes, ensuring that they're always in tip-top shape.  Everyone in the shop is super-friendly and anxious to ensure that we have everything we need to ensure an outstanding biking experience.

name: Ingrid Davis
text: Great service, great selection and great prices!! Everything you want in a bike shop. The staff is really courteous and helpful and will walk you through whatever you may need.

name: Collene Underwood
text: Really the best place to go for all your bike needs. Chris was so nice and helpful with fitting/ fixing/ and explaining my bike to me. He broke everything down simply and made me feel so comfortable... (even with my little knowledge of riding). He took the time to help me based on my goals and current needs with no pressure or upselling. It's just very clear the people who work here really enjoy what they do. I will go here for all my future needs.

name: Geo Ritt
text: Great service, reasonable price!

name: Ford Adams
text:
I called to ask about tandem bicycles. The lady who answered the phone gave me a brief description of the one they sell, although they're not currently in stock. She then directed me to go online to look at them (fair enough, I suppose). I then asked her if she could ballpark the price on one, and she said she couldn't, and then directed me online to look at the price. Lady, if I wanted to go look everything up online myself, then I would just order it online myself! The whole reason I called was to get the service of a local business, and, in return, to spend my money with a local business!

I'm giving 2 stars instead of one, because they answered the phone.

name: John Bryson
text: Outstanding customer service and product; love my TREK since 1987!

name: Ben Nemec
text: Great service and communication. Professional and knowledgeable.

name: Robert Handford
text: A few days ago I gave Bicycle Cove a bad review based on my experience with service scheduling and the price of a pair of gloves.  When I expressed my concern in person after I posted the review, they made up for the issues and I'm totally satisfied now.  Thanks very much!!!

name: Frances Graham
text: I can't say enough nice things about Bicycle Cove. We were in need of a sturdier bike rack for an upcoming trip.  Ruth Marie Oliver was super helpful and knowledgeable and helped us get fitted with an appropriate rack at the last minute. She went totally out of her way to help us near closing time just before we were due to go out of town. Thanks again!

name: Ana Isabel Da Silva
text: They have great quality bikes and customer service!

name: Michael Vinson
text: Great shop. Staff is knowledgeable and they have competitive prices. There is a repair shop one site too.

name: Lorin Jackson
text: There’s nothing like a local bike shop! Everyone that I had the pleasure of speaking to throughout my bicycle search and purchase was extremely patient, helpful, and knowledgable!

name: Orrin Coufal
text: Took my new bike to Bicycle Cove because they wouldn’t have me a price over the phone to look over my bike, torque stuff down, and make sure it’s safe. That’s fine. Somewhat understandable since they don’t know what all will be involved. The mechanic comes out and was a little rude to be honest. It was like he was being inconvenienced. Still couldn’t give me a quote but took my name and number and said they would call the following day. I finally get a call a few days later but they were looking for someone else. I explain that I am waiting for a call and she says okay and hangs up. So I went to Trailhead and got everything I needed done for less than it would have cost to have the wheels trued at Bicycle Cove. Trailhead is great. Bicycle Cove, not so much.

resp.text:
Orrin,

To say I’m mortified by what happened in my store is a gross understatement.  I’m super embarrassed for lots of reasons.  However, the key reason is I’m the tech who spoke with you, and I’m on the owner.  My behavior and performance sets the tone for the rest of the store.  I can assure you what happened is far from the norm, and I completely understand why you are so disappointed by your experience!   What happened  to you falls under human error. When your information was put in to the work order list the wrong status was selected.  So, this whole time the techs thought we were waiting on you to bring the bike instead of you waiting on us for a phone call.  How embarrassing!

I know there are a lot of choices for bike shops in the area, and I’m grateful you were able to get what you needed done at Trailhead.  Tommy and his crew are great people.

I’m super hopeful you will be willing to give us a second chance.

Thank you so much for your feedack!

name: Sabrina Stedman
text: I really enjoyed working with the Cove Monte Sano location on bicycle selection, fitting and outfitting my new bike. We were able to complete my purchase safely and respectfully with regards to quarantine guidelines. Thank you! See you on the mountain or at one of the triathlon events!

name: Ashley Collins
text: Great experience working with knowledgeable and helpful staff even during these crazy times!! So excited for the new adventures I will find riding my new bike!

name: Regan Christian
text: Good selection and helpful, knowledgeable staff. I have not had service done on a bike there yet.

name: Thomas Kennedy
text: I really like having them work on my bicycle. The location is convenient. They are helpful and friendly. They’ve always done a good job and I trust them.

name: Wayne Alvis
text: Shopped here for 7 years. Best customer service ever!

name: Adrian Owen
text: Awesome bike fit from Chris. I had been wanting to get this done for awhile now & the experience did not disappoint! It truly feels like i’m riding a different bike. I drove 1.5 hours and will definitely be back. Everyone I met was helpful & knowledgeable. Great place!!

name: Darrel White
text: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff! We can't wait to join them for events!

name: gerald brackett
text: Great experience in Hampton Cove (Brownsboro) store. Just wanted to say thanks to Chris, Ruth, and Tommy for all of the hard work and extra time that was put into ordering, reordering, re-shipping, and building my P1 dream bike. Great store....great people. Best bike shop in the state. We are lucky to have this place in Huntsville!

name: MH
text: Friendly and knowledgeable! Had my bike in for tuneup and tire replacement! Will use them again.

name: Jim Morris
text: I recently bought a very nice Trek bicycle and accessories from Bicycle Cove.  The salesperson, is a very helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly person who made it a very pleasant buying experience.  Chris adjusted my bike perfectly and everyone I've dealt with is friendly and helpful.  I'm happy to give Bicycle Cove my highest recommendation.

name: Morgan Sisk
text: Excellent customer service! The staff is very knowledgeable and went above and beyond, not only in servicing my bike, but by providing race-day recommendations and advice. I could not imagine taking my bike anywhere else.

name: S T
text: Chris and his team at Bicycle Cove go above and beyond to ensure that you are completely satisfied with the product you have purchased from his store.  Definitely one of the better bike shops in Huntsville.

name: Luke Short
text: I wish I could give them six stars. Thanks for the fast fix, you saved our trip.

name: Suzanne Erickson
text: Absolutely love the outstanding customer service and attention to detail I receive each time I walk in to this shop, but the very best thing is the 48 hour guaranteed service turn around time. It's hard to be without my bike, so getting it back quickly is a top priority to me. Thank you Bicycle Cove!

name: Harry Pennington
text: Helpful and courteous staff. Very good attention to detail. High quality of repair work - very thorough.

name: Don Counts
text:
I appreciate the time Ruth Marie Oliver gave
me demonstrating the latest technologies in cycling.

name: BCM
text: This used to be my go to place for my bike.  Unfortunately not anymore.  I have noticed since summer last year the customer service started falling.  With covid it has become non existent and almost down right rude.  I get they are busy, but won't answer phone calls and when they do they don't care if you come in or not.  The Trek bikes are not proving to be reliable IMO.  I have had to replace too many items on a bike that is two years old.   I have a 10 yr old giant that has only had cables replaced once.

resp.text:
BCM,

Covid and the resulting Bike Boom has put a massive strain on my staff.  Business increased 10x out of the blue, and staff stayed the same.  We are continuing to learn how to operate in our new normal.  Getting feedback both positive and negative helps us to do a better job. Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we are doing.

I'm sorry we are no longer your go-to shop.  Is there something we can do to earn your business back?  Would you be willing to be more specific about the issues you are having with your bike?  I would be super grateful if you'd be willing to call the shop (256-533-2300) so we work together to find a solution.

Thanks!
Chris

name: Jeff Mccorveysproshop
text: Ben is very knowledgable and easy to work with. I would highly recommend him.

name: Amy Stahlman
text: Great staff. Good selection of bikes. I would recommend.

name: Kari Lippert
text: The staff is always so friendly and helpful. It's been great working with them.

name: Dana DeBardelaben
text: We are fortunate to have several great bike shops in Madison County. Everyone who works here is friendly and helpful. They have what I need and have done great work on my bikes and my husband's bike. Chris does a great job fitting the bike to you (rather than trying to make your body conform to the bike).

name: Michael Behr
text: Been on the ambassador program for 2 years. The Cove knows how to take care of people. They have an awesome 48 hour turn around on most repairs!

name: Mark Hudnall
text: Friendly and expert staff.  Quick turnaround on tune-ups and repairs.  They stand behind what they sell and provide incredible and personable customer service!!!  Trek Owner x3!

name: Bramblett Day
text: Great service the 2 individuals that helped me did not try to make a sale they were genuinely interested in helping me get the repairs I needed.  I went in on 28 Dec 2018 with around a 20 year old bike.  Ben looked it over told me what he thought needed to fixed.  Ben called me on the 29th with some minor adjustments to his previous assessment.   The total cost was around the same he had previously quoted me. Ben called me back on the 29th to tell me my bike was done.  The staff at Bicycle Cove is extremely friendly and helpful. I will be back with any of my future bicycle needs.

name: Derek Rose
text: Great bike shop! They have built one wheel for me and trued another. Each time they were very helpful and they had it done very quickly - their prices are very reasonable! They are also great for answering biking questions and helping out with the small stuff that comes up.

name: Brad McClellan
text: Fast friendly service. They try to get quick repairs done while you wait. I will definitely go back

name: olga steiner
text: The best Service!

name: Jessica Johnson
text: Wonderful experience! Ruth was friendly and knowledgable. I highly recommend Bicycle Cove!

name: Jeff Hataway
text: I bought my 2nd bike from Bicycle Cove over the weekend. They have a great selection of bikes and the customer service is second to none. I have recommended them to many friends and always enjoy the bike buying experience.

name: Nelson Crouch
text: The people at Bicycle Cove are the best.  They have kept my bikes in perfect condition for 5 years and have made adjustment to my bike fit that have allowed me to ride over 12,000 miles so far.

name: Lori C
text: Great selection of cycling gear and bicycles for adults and kids. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful.

name: Linda Hisaw
text: A great place to buy a bike. They were very patient with me while helping me find the perfect bike. I love the bike and often tell others about Bicycle Cove. I wish they had free maintenance for the life of the bike like some of the other shops in Huntsville, but it was worth getting the perfect bike for me. Linda Hisaw

name: Susan DeBacker
text: I loved the service here and everyone including, Cody the dog were very friendly, and made me feel very welcome there. I'm also super happy with my brand new tricycle that I'll be riding in the downtown Hsv Mardi Gras parade this afternoon!

name: Jeremy Biggs
text: Very helpful, put up with me; we will be back!

name: Kirstin DeRosa
text: Staff is very knowledgeable and even more helpful (they installed my bike rack for me!). It is clear that they are passionate about bicycles. Totally worth the drive.

name: Andy Dorman
text: Very helpful and prices were pretty good.

name: Steve Justice
text: Dope-azz bike shop. Sick bikes and killer service. I broke my rig hucking it off a sweet jump. My homies were like, "send it, bro." I was like "Nah, I don't even have my Enduro bike, dude." I boofed the landing and jacked my suspension. I took my steed to Bicycle Cove and was like "Brah, I mitted my sled shredding the gnar, can you help?" They were like "no problemo, bruh." They tweaked my piece and I was railing again in no time. Thanks Bicycle Cove, you're the dopest.

name: C R
text: Amazing people.  Helped me get my bike back together after destroying it at Monta sana. Even offered to help with first aid and printed me directions back to where I was staying. Seriously the nicest people I have met in Alabama.

name: Chad Stutts
text: Chris and his staff helped find and fit the perfect bike for my wife. Thanks!

name: Mel H
text: Always kind and friendly service that can fix our bicycles.

name: Paulo Cardoso
text: Great crew and nice place for cyclists...

name: Kyle Jett
text: Professional, friendly, and very helpful! I would highly recommend Bicycle Cove!

name: Randy Carter
text: Always very friendly, and very helpful!

name: Lisa Eskridge
text: Way above and beyond our expectations, every, single, time!!

name: Lonnie Cawthorn
text: A great store!

name: Matthew Bell
text: Best bike shop in Alabama.

name: Michael Lane
text: Fantastic, honest, and fun people to work with.

name: Edgar Iwamoto
text: Couldn't find the product I was looking for anywhere in town or online for months.  Then LG Outdoors posted it was IN STOCK!  and ordered a few boxes.  Got the confirmation and notice of shipment emails soon thereafter, and the product in only SEVEN days time! Wonderful during this pandemic! Product is as described, and have already sent quite a number downrange!  Thanks LG!

name: Laura Rothermund
text: We placed an order and got a tracking number within a half an hour of doing so and received our products in about 4 days!! Shipping was so fast! Almost unheard of these days! We were very pleased with reasonable prices too!

name: N McGuire
text: this was the first time I ordered from lg outdoors and they were just great! In the midst of this insanity we've been forced to endure and as far as ordering anything online with delay upon delay you guys were none of that! my order was shipped within a couple of days and it was on my doorstep before the week ended ! thank you very much!

name: Charles Johnson
text: Lg Outdoors,treated me with respect. I really appreciated the fast service they rendered. It really didn’t take long for them to send my order. They’re are a good company. Sincerely Charles J.

name: DBNY23
text: I have added LG Outdoors to my list of dealers I look at when shopping. I ordered a case of 5.7x28 ammo last week and it shipped very quickly and was well packaged.  Was great being able to buy the ammo I needed without having to pay the huge premiums it is selling for on places like Gun Broker.

name: William Hejl
text: First time ordering from LG Outdoors but not the last!  They were great answering my questions and shipped the product in a very timely manner.  Thanks!

name: B737Jim
text: The product I ordered came fast and was exactly what I was looking for. I wouldn’t hesitate to order from them again.

name: Bram S
text: Hogue stock. Had just what I was looking for in stock. Prices were in the ballpark. Paid a few dollars more then some of the other sites I found. But they had it in stock! And plenty worth it, considering it arrived days earlier then anticipated. Will definitely use them again.

name: Ernie Wroten
text: this was my first time placing an order with these folks. the process was extremely easy and they sent emails with each step in the process of the order from beginning to end. I recommend this company and will definitely use them again.

name: Tom Szczepaniak
text: I was glad to finally find some small rifle magnum primers to keep my 223 and 450 Bushmaster going.  Shipping was fast too.

name: Rob Coopman
text: I ordered my item from LG Outdoors through the auction site Gunbroker.  The transaction was flawless and I received my order promptly, and at a great price.   If another opportunity presents itself I will not hesitate to do business with LG Outdoors again!

name: Mark Nice
text: I was very surprised to find the bullets that I needed after failing to find them at other sources.  LG Outdoors not only had them in stock, but at a very reasonable price, and they arrived at my home in just a few days!!  I've ordered from LG Outdoors in the past and I've always been pleased with my purchases.

name: mmalf
text: Top notch place to shop.  Easy order, fast delivery, and quick to respond if there is a customer concern.

name: Nicole Offenheiser
text: I highly recommend LG Outdoors! I ordered ammo from their website and it was a smooth transaction. I was glad that they had 380 ammo in stock during this ammo shortage. Shipping was very quick and I received email notifications throughout the entire shipping process.

name: Loren Wilson
text: After searching extensively for .45 LC cartridge cases I found a good supply of Winchester cases here.  My order was filled and shipped quickly and arrived by FedEx delivery in perfect condition.  I am very happy with my experience ordering from LG-Outdoors.

name: Damon Weatherspoon
text: Ordered some VERY hard to find ammo! Excellent price and SUPER fast shipping. I will definitely order again if the item becomes available.

name: steve ivie
text: LG was one of the few places I could get the caliper I needed for the rifle handed down from my father. Their shipping was prompt and kept me informed along the way. Product works as it should, will be re-ordering.

text: Gun broker product as described and for a very fair price.  Shipped super fast!  Will do biz again with you guys thank you!

name: Jim Wilson

text: Received item quickly, was correct product as advertised. No hassle. Great prices I highly recommend this company.

name: David Thompson
text: I was hesitant at first to place an order with this company due to the nature of some of the reviews. I ordered a 1851 Colt Navy .44 caliber steel frame revolver from them and I couldn't be happier. Great price and I received it within 1 week. The transaction couldn't have gone smoother!! It's an absolutely gorgeous piece and a great price. I tried to order the same revolver from dixie gun works and after one month it still hadn't shipped so I cancelled the order. Shipping was fast even with a nationwide firearms and ammo shortage as well as the pandemic crisis.  I could not be happier,  I will order from them again. Great job you guys !!!

name: JS
text:
Gouging with over pricing of Rifle Primers.  Jacked up the price 7 times the normal selling price.  No Thanks LG Outdoors!

Update: Received a response from LG Outdoors and they pretty much played the blame game on bots buying up all the Primers. At $419.99 for a box of 1000 Primers is a ridiculous price. Normally primers are $0.04 each and with this price, it makes it $0.41 each. Just shows human greed from a company. Understand there is a shortage. Maybe hold off on selling Primers until supplies come readily available and go back to a reasonable price. I yes I have not bought from this company and never will. Karma will come back to you in the end.

resp.text:
We have an A+ rating on the BBB
If you want true reviews of our company then please check out our reviews at resellerratings.com where we have over 3,726 reviews with an average of 4.72 out of 5. Most of these negative Google reviews are not true and most are not even from customers of ours. They are mainly left by internet trolls that got together on chat forms and decided to try and burn us to send business to one of their buddies. Please look at the other reviews they have left and you will see for yourself. If you would like to call us before placing an order with us we welcome your call. Our # is (888) 547-4679 We take calls M-F 8 AM to 6 PM. You can also email us at service@LG-Outdoors.com

So you are complaining but you have not bought anything from us and you can't find it cheaper anywhere else so you're mad at us because we have current lowest price.?  If you can buy it for less some where else, why are you not buying from them and wasting your time complaining to us.  No matter what we set the price at, you would never be able to buy it because the guys running the Bots buy it all up before you ever get a chance.  Yes prices are because the public drove them up not us.  I advise very one not to buy more than they need but way t many people are hoarding  and making the problem worst.

Jason Marsh

name: Adam Osiecki
text:
Price gouging at its finest. I received a notification that they had primers in stock, so I went to place an order. They were asking $315/1000 for Federal small pistol match primers and $250 for Federal large rifle primers. These normally go for about $50 and $40 respectively. They are 100% trying to take advantage of people due to the shortage. Between this and the fact that they are probably one of the worst reviewed companies I've ever seen I can't believe anybody gives this place a dime. It'd probably be less painful to burn the money you were going to give them and throw yourself down the stairs.

Edited to add:  Your response is laughable. All the reputable stores (Midway USA, Natchez, Brownells, Cabelas, etc.) are still selling primers for regular price. They just sell out as soon as they get them in stock so you need to have in stock alerts set up and be ready to buy immediately. You look even worse for trying to justify being a price gouger.

Edited to add again:  I see you've changed your response from justifying your price gouging to now claiming there is some coordinated effort to attack your company.  I personally don't know, nor have I communicated in any way with any of the other reviewers.  If you think reviews from perspective buyers who opted not to buy from your company due to shady business practices are irrelevant, then you are a complete moron.  But go ahead and try to dismiss valid reviews of your company genius.

name: Thomas Hepler
text: 1000% mark up on prices, its a shame stores are taking advantage of consumers. I used to pay .04 cents a primer, now paying over .42 cents for the same thing.

resp.text: We are truly as upset about the price of primers as the public , but we have no controls over that.  You and the public set the price.  If these primers were any lower cost, you would not be able to buy them because some else would have already bought all of them.  The only reason you have any chance at all buy some is due to the fact they are priced at the low end of the market price, any lowered and they sell out instantly before you even get a chance.  So is it better not to be able to buy any at all, or is it better to be able to pay a little more and just buy enough for you immediate needs.  The public sets the price they are willing to pay.  When the goods are priced lower than market, they are gone instantly ad most people never have the chance to buy any at all.  More often than most people realize the market price for some things is far below cost and dealer and distributors end up selling them at a loss.  The good must continue to move, it does no good to eave product on the shelve that doesn't, it gets discounted until it reaches the market price and ten it will finally sell and if that is below cost we have to eat it.  You never hear customers complain that they bought some thing too cheap.  It works both ways my friend.  Personally I will not pay the going prices and I thing every one needs to slow down so prices go back down to normal.

name: Southern Adventure Outdoors
text: My name is Brandon Conley. I too had a poor experience with Shelly. I ordered an item from Amazon. an air purifier. It was sent "adult signature required" in error by the warehouse. That is different than "signature required" shipping. Adult sig required  means no changes, no address change, no local UPS store pickup. LG outdoors tried to change it on Thursday. I tried to have it re-routed and couldnt. Saturday delivery was not even an option. I had no way to sign for the package without taking time off work. I could only pick up from a UPS hub that was over an hour from my house so I had UPS return the item. The item arrived back to them on Friday. On Tuesday I told them to just send the item back via regular shipping. A man from customer service and I had a pleasant conversation about this on Thursday. This week Shelly has been in. On Tuesday she said she was waiting on the warehouse to respond to their emails. Today which is Wednesday I sent another email asking for an update since I was suppose to hear back by end of business on Tuesday. Shelly told me they were still waiting on the warehouse and I should hear back by the end of the day today. I told her that is exactly what you told me yesterday. She then said they were waiting to hear back from me on if I wanted a refund or return shipment. I told her that we had emailed yesterday about just sending it back and that everything she has told me so far has been a lie and all seems repetitive. Shelly then raised her voice, changed her tone to a very condescending one. After you all made an error and I still was patient and tried to work you, you give me the customer and attitude and hang up the phone? So yes. #$%* you just give me a refund. I even called back to give her another chance. She answered the phone with an attitude. Look at their feedback on amazon and on here. It seems Shelly has been losing more business than her services are worth.  Their negative reviews are increasing according to their amazon profile. 20% over the past year and now 28% over the past 6 months with less reviews being left. My advice is to close the doors on Shelly or close the doors on your 20 year old business. I will work with you to correct an error and we tried that until she got involved. I understand that mistakes happen but I will not be downgraded and spoken to like a child while attempting to do business with you.

name: D O
text:
Terrible experience and I sure wish I would have read these reviews prior to purchasing!  Although the gun came quickly and sales staff is friendly the owner himself seems a bit off balance.  I am active duty military stationed in AL and when I went to pick up the rifle I showed my military ID and my AL concealed carry permit.  The owner wanted a copy of my USMC orders bringing me here to AL and when I stated that is not something we generally carry on our persons, he stated it was federal law. When I questioned him in an attempt to get a better understanding of the law and using as example in the last 18 months I have purchased weapons from Walter Craig, Gulf States Distributors, and Gander Mountain in Montgomery with no requirement to furnish a copy of my military orders, he no kidding exploded!  Literally told me to get the (f-bleep) out of his store and he would charge me for a restocking fee!  This was one of the most insane and oddest moments I have ever had in a retailers shop.  This experience is difficult to describe in believable terms and was rather off putting.  As far as I could tell he was the only angry person on the premises.

I was able to talk to his sales staff and they explained that it was his policy.  I understand that and the information upfront would have been extremely helpful.  I want to comply with any reasonable store policies and would have had I known this was an issue for the owner.  In the end my wife was able to email me a copy and I completed the transaction.  His salesman saved the purchase and I truly believe he is a sincere and helpful person.

Having said all that I really think purchasing from this establishment is a mistake and I wish I would have walked after the verbal assault and string of profanities.  If you do decide to venture into his place of business be careful; He appeared genuinely angry (which should concern any responsible gun owner), completely narcissistic, not open to any conversation that would question his authority, and is armed!  This man went from 0 to 100 in a nano-second over an issue that I still can’t quite figure out.  Could be he is not a fan of the Marine Corps or the military in general...hope that is not the case and he was just having a bad day but I won’t trust him with my business again.
